title: EIPIP Meeting 62 Agenda
body:
## Date and Time

Wednesday, August 10, 2022, at 14:00 UTC 

## Location

Zoom: TBA in the Discord #eip-editing channel

YouTube Live Stream/Recording: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxpLrRIkDlBjDUUrGgF91pQw

## Agenda

### 1. Make EIP authorship depend on ENS

### 2. From GitHub Issue or Pull Request

1. https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/5294
2. [Fix EIP Bot ](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/5400)
3. https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/5414 & https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/5422 [Discussion Thread](https://discord.com/channels/916516304972824576/1006279511953899560/1006279519566577744)
4. https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/5379
5. https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/5415
6. https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/5424
7. https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/5408

Misc.
- PandaPip1 added as a maintainer of the EIP-Bot repository. [Discord](https://discord.com/channels/916516304972824576/916713912970412103/1005597767588134962)
- Remove Contributors section from README

### 3.  EIP bots related discussion, updates, agreement on merging PRs & closing Issues.
- eip-bot [Issues](https://github.com/ethereum/EIP-Bot/issues) and [Pull Request](https://github.com/ethereum/EIP-Bot/pulls)
  - https://github.com/ethereum/EIP-Bot/pull/111 (Doesn't change code)
  - https://github.com/ethereum/EIP-Bot/pull/109 (Fully E2E tested, confirmed working)
  - https://github.com/ethereum/EIP-Bot/pull/105 (Added test cases, they pass)

### 4. Past meeting discussion continued
a. One-time NFT Sale of unused EIP numbers Ref: [Issue](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/5082)
b. Meta EIP for the Executable Spec process for Core EIPs

### 5. [EIPs Insight](https://hackmd.io/@poojaranjan/EthereumImprovementProposalsInsight/) - Monthly EIPs status reporting.

### 6. EIP editor apprenticeship meeting
- Meeting 23  

### 7. Review action items from the previous meeting
- Sam Wilson and Tim Beiko will create a Meta EIP for the Executable Spec process before showing the proposal to the core devs. Remaining EIP editors to give their view on using the executable spec in the EIP process

**Next meeting** - Aug 24, 2022

(Anything else, please add a comment)
